title: Did Riot's balance team go on a drinking party this PBE patch?
body:
Jinx W can crit. That's a 350% AD ratio on her W with IE if it crits.

If Lux's R kills a champion, it grants 30/40/50% cooldown refund. (Which by the way, doesn't state it cannot stack right now with current text.) Her average build and mastery set is 40% CDR. That puts her R at a 15 second cooldown if it kills someone in lategame. If she went 45% CDR, it goes down to 13.75 seconds.

Kassadin is being buffed. The champion that had managed to reach the single highest banrate in League's entire history and got gutted for a good reason.

FUCKING 15 SECOND COOLDOWN ON KAT ULT AT RANK 3.

Um, the change right now buffs her lategame which is fine.

The reason Jinx struggles just like almost every other crit ADC is because of their shit early, whereas Lethality ADCs have a much stronger early and just overpower them. Partially due to Lethality being extremely strong still.

I think the Jinx change is fine. Jinx has always been feast or famine, more so than other ADCs. For example, if Ashe gets behind she is still useful with her hawkshot and ult. If Jinx gets behind, then it's pretty much gg for her. She's useless unless you can drag out the game to the point where she has 6 items. 

So I think this change is fine, it fits with her feast or famine kit. If Jinx is behind, it doesn't matter if zap can crit because 1) It won't do much damage anyways and 2) She probably wont have the crit items so the chance of zap being a crit will be low. 

If Jinx is ahead, it will be doing a crap ton of damage which is what Jinx is supposed to do. 

I think there is an argument for toning down the AD ratio now that it can crit, but overall I don't think it's a bad change.

Also, c'mon, if you cant sidestep her zap then you deserve to get hit, crit or no crit.
